node.title: Thunderstorm asthma warning for Melbourne and surrounds as more storms to lash the city
node.description: Melburnians are once again being told to batten down the hatches while remaining on high alert for thunderstorm asthma conditions, with forecast high pollen levels and strong winds sparking warnings.
node.content:
["Victorians are being urged to remain alert, with more wild weather to lash the state this afternoon.", "Severe thunderstorms are likely to hit Melbourne, particularly the western suburbs, as well as other parts of central Victoria.", "The weather bureau has warned of heavy downpours, large hail and strong wind gusts, as well as the potential for epidemic\u00a0thunderstorm asthma conditions to develop.", "Senior forecaster Christopher Arvier said\u00a0conditions should ease later tonight.", "\"We are looking at the storms essentially from 2pm onwards and moving through the city areas between 4pm and 6pm is the most likely time,\" he said.", "Mr Arvier said the thunderstorm asthma risk was most concerning in the area that included\u00a0Melbourne and Geelong.", "\"Most districts have a moderate rating for thunderstorm asthma, but the central district, which includes Melbourne and Geelong, has a high risk of thunderstorm asthma with these storms as they move through the city this afternoon,\" he said.", "According to the bureau, those with asthma, hayfever and seasonal rhinitis are at risk of developing symptoms before and during the storms because of the combination of\u00a0high grass pollen levels and thunderstorms with strong winds.", "People are advised to avoid wind gusts leading up to the storm and to stay inside with windows and doors closed.", "Yesterday, storms that dumped 24 millimetres of rain in Melbourne's CBD within 15 minutes led to localised flash flooding, with cars becoming submerged in some areas such as Footscray.", "No injuries were reported.", "
Asthma sufferers warned to be cautious
", "Department of Health adviser\u00a0Professor Mike Roberts said the extreme weather conditions will generate high levels of airborne pollen, creating a major risk to any asthma sufferers\u00a0outdoors.", "\"From now onwards I would suggest, until the thunderstorm has passed, that people at risk do go indoors, shut their doors, shut their windows and stay there until the risk has passed,\" Professor Roberts said.", "To prevent illness, asthma sufferers have been urged by health authorities to take preventative doses of any asthma medication they may have.\u00a0", "", "
Professor Mike Roberts said hospitalisation remains a real risk to asthma sufferers.(ABC News)
", "Professor Roberts said even Victorians with no prior history of respiratory issues should remain vigilant, with the weather conditions able to trigger asthma attacks regardless of underlying allergies or health issues.", "A 2016 thunderstorm asthma event in Melbourne resulted in more than\u00a03,500 emergency presentations, 35 ICU admissions and 10 deaths.", "A coronial inquest into the deaths, held later that year, found that victims had a greater chance of survival if those around them recognised the seriousness of their symptoms relatively quickly.", "\"In the 2016 outbreak there were a few people who had no symptoms, no history of anything at all who developed asthma for the first time,\" Professor Roberts said.", "\"So there is a small risk of that happening to people who have got no history at all.\"", "Those suffering from asthma or breathing problems are urged to seek help immediately."]
